class.name: PIXI.autoDetectRenderer

parameters.name: width=800
parameters.help: the width of the renderers view

parameters.name: height=600
parameters.help: the height of the renderers view

parameters.name: [options.view]
parameters.help: the canvas to use as a view, optional

parameters.name: [options.transparent=false]
parameters.help: If the render view is transparent, default false

parameters.name: [options.antialias=false]
parameters.help: sets antialias (only applicable in chrome at the moment)

parameters.name: [options.preserveDrawingBuffer=false]
parameters.help: enables drawing buffer preservation, enable this if you need to call toDataUrl on the webgl context

parameters.name: [options.resolution=1]
parameters.help: the resolution of the renderer retina would be 2

class.help:
This helper function will automatically detect which renderer you should be using.
WebGL is the preferred renderer as it is a lot faster. If webGL is not supported by
the browser then this function will return a canvas renderer
